author: avestura
body:
![UqoPy4ryiP](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9091958/59467575-4602ff80-8e45-11e9-91a5-704e7b483990.gif)


# Steps to reproduce
Use any suggestion with many items, for example write `[System.T` and press `ctrl+space`
in console hosts like ConEmu or Visual Studio Code Terminal, then choose an item. (This doesn't happen in the main PowerShell host)

# Expected behavior
The item should be auto-completed and then hide from screen.

# Actual behavior
The item gets selected but remains on screen.

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.1            TypedReference
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
This is a PSReadLine issue.
@0xaryan Can you please move the issue report to https://github.com/powershell/psreadline? The bug report template there has a script for you to run to collect some extra environment data, which would be very helpful to the diagnosis.

comments.author: avestura
daxian-dbw
comments.body: Sorry for the ambiguity. I mean reopening the issue in the PSReadLine repository.

title: PowerShell 7-preview1 Suggestions remians on screen even after selecting an item
